p: The result of disc diffusion analysis was sufficient enough to illustrate that 75 Âµl tar oil solution produced growth inhibition of microbial strains. Serial dilution of 1/10, 1 /100, and 1/100 of tar oil were conducted against P. gingivalis and P. intermedia, A. actinomycetemcomitans species. The inhibitory results were similar to the original tar oil for 1.10 and 1.100 dilutions. However, no inhibition was noticed with the 1/1000 dilution
